009package imagingbook.common.color.iterate;
010
011import imagingbook.common.color.sets.ColorEnumeration;
012
013import java.awt.Color;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This class defines methods for iterating over an ordered set of AWT colors. The color set can be constructed from
018 * individual AWT colors (see {@link #FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Color...)}) or an enum class implementing
019 * {@link ColorEnumeration} (see {@link #FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Class)}).
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * Usage examples:
023 * </p>
024 * <pre>
025 * // from individual colors (or array of colors):
026 * ColorSequencer iter1 = new FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Color.blue, Color.green, Color.red);
027 * for (int i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++) {
028 *      Color c = iter1.next();
029 *      // use color c
030 * }
031 * // from enum type:
032 * FiniteLinearColorSequencer iter2 = new FiniteLinearColorSequencer(BasicAwtColor.class);
033 * iter2.reset(5);
034 * for (int i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++) {
035 *      Color c = iter2.nextRandom();
036 *      // use color c
037 * }
038 * </pre>
039 *
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2022/04/06
042 * @see Color
043 * @see ColorEnumeration
044 */
045public class FiniteLinearColorSequencer implements ColorSequencer {
046
047        protected final Color[] colorArray;
048        protected int next = 0;
049
050        public FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Color... colors) {
051                if (colors.length == 0) {
052                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("color set may not be empty!");
053                }
054                this.colorArray = colors.clone();
055        }
056
057        public FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Class<? extends ColorEnumeration> clazz) {
058//              this.colorArray = ColorEnumeration.getColors(clazz);
059                this(ColorEnumeration.getColors(clazz));
060        }
061        
062        // -------------------------------------------------------
063
064        public int size() {
065                return colorArray.length;
066        }
067
068        public Color getColor(int idx) {
069                return colorArray[idx];
070        }
071
072        public Color[] getColors() {
073                return colorArray;
074        }
075
076        // --- iteration stuff -----------------------------------
077
078        /**
079         * Reset the iterator, such that the color returned by the following call to {@link #next()} has index 0.
080         */
081        public void reset() {
082                reset(0);
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * Reset the iterator such that the index of the item returned by the following call to {@link #next()} has the
087         * specified start index.
088         *
089         * @param offset the new start index
090         */
091        public void reset(int offset) {
092                this.next = Math.floorMod(offset, colorArray.length);
093        }
094
095        @Override
096        public Color next() {
097                Color nc = colorArray[next];
098                next = (next + 1) % colorArray.length;
099                return nc;
100        }
101
102}
